title-group.article-title: Tailored Hybrid Blanks in Steel and Aluminium

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2002 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Thyssen Tailored Hybrid Blanks (THB) are coldformable combinations of steel and aluminium sheets. They include linear lap joints fabricated by means of a laser-assisted roll bonding technique. The initial development work has meanwhile progressed to the stage where a pilot line is set to start up operation and fabricate hybrid blanks in shapes and sizes required for automotive engineering applications. The present state of development, a possible spectrum of products, and main process parameters are discussed. Research into the forming behaviour of hybrid blanks is looked at, citing practical examples, added with findings from metallographic analyses and corrosion testing.

ref.mixed-citation: Polzin, M., Poprawe, R., Kawalla, R. and Pircher, H.: „Transition Joints: New Ways of Design for Aluminium-Steel, Light Weight Body Components", Advanced Technologies & Processes, IBEC '95, pp. 124 + 126
Jaroni, U., Pircher, H., Stegemann, Th. and Nagel, M.: „Tailored Blanks in Hybrid Technique Steel -Aluminium", Materials & Body Testing, IBEC '96, pp. 114-115
„Laser-Assisted Plating of Strip", United States Patent No. 6,002,98
„Method and Device of Joining Fiat Products to be connected such that they overlap", International Patent WO 98/14301
R. Aristotile: "Fatigue resistance of spot welded joints for car body construction", ECSC Conv. 7210 KA/406, Final report, 1985

V. Rustia, P. Di Nunzio: "Fatigue resistance of laser welded coated steel joints for automotive applications: comparison with spot welded joints", ECSC Conv. 7210 MB/401, Final report, 1997 (EUR Publication 16631IT)
